meanings.definition: A freshwater fish of the perch family, similar to a walleye.
meanings.sent1: The sauger swam gracefully in the river.
meanings.sent2: I caught a sauger while fishing at the lake.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sauger refuse to play cards? Because it was afraid of the hook!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a sauger in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sauger's scales shimmered like diamonds in the water.

meanings.sent1: We decided to sauger at the nearby creek.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys saugering on weekends with his friends.
meanings.sent3: Why did the angler bring a ladder to sauger? To reach the best spot!
meanings.sent4: She hoped to sauger some big ones for dinner.
meanings.sent5: The old man taught his grandson how to sauger patiently.
